file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 53-21-13-04 - SERVICE-DOOR PROTECTIVE PLATE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL SERVICE-DOOR PROTECTIVE PLATE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: FOR AIRCRAFT WITH PROTECTIVE PLATE INSTALLED 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the service-door protective plate. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY FOR AIRCRAFT WITH SERVICE-DOOR PROTECTIVE PLATE - PROTECTIVE PLATE 53-21-13-000-801-A REMOVAL INSTALLED FOR AIRCRAFT WITH SERVICE-DOOR PROTECTIVE PLATE - PROTECTIVE PLATE 53-21-13-400-801-A INSTALLATION INSTALLED EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 53-21-13 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 53-21-13-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: FOR AIRCRAFT WITH PROTECTIVE PLATE INSTALLED 2. SERVICE-DOOR PROTECTIVE PLATE - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to remove the service-door protective plate. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 53-01-02-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 53-01-02-000-802-A/400 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION Passenger cabin - RH (STGR 16R thru 232 SRTGR 5R) D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin - RH I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) If it is necessary to install a new protective plate, do these steps: (a) Open the service door. (b) Remove the passenger-cabin floor panels. Refer to AMM TASK 53-01-02-000-801-A/400 or AMM TASK 53-01-02-000-802-A/400, as applicable. J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Remove the screws (1). AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) Remove the protective plate (2). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 53-21-13 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 53-21-13-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: FOR AIRCRAFT WITH PROTECTIVE PLATE INSTALLED 3. SERVICE-DOOR PROTECTIVE PLATE - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to install the service-door protective plate. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 53-01-02-400-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 53-01-02-400-802-A/400 - CPM 51-21-05 - IPC 53-31-00 REAR I SRM 51-20-01 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION Passenger cabin - RH (STGR 16R thru 232 SRTGR 5R) D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) MIL-S-8802 type II class B2 Sealant, rubber - PR1440B2 AR MIL-S-81733 type II-2 Sealant, polysulfide gray - P/S870B-2 AR MSM 36-002 type I Silicone grease, light consistency - Molykote DC-33 light AR MEP 09-060 Corrosion-Inhibiting Compound (CA-1000) AR G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) Service-door protective plate IPC 53-31-00 1 H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin - RH EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 53-21-13 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Preparation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 841-003-A (1) If it is necessary to install a new protective plate, do these steps: (a) Put the new protective plate on the fuselage skin. (b) Transfer the holes from the fuselage skin to the protective plate. (c) Drill the holes in the protective plate. See DET. B for the final hole diameter. J. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Remove the old aerodynamic sealant. NOTE: Contact Embraer Technical Support if you find signs of corrosion in the skin holes or on the screws (1). (2) Apply epoxy primer in the skin holes where the protective plate is attached. For epoxy primer application, refer to CPM 51-21-05 (3) Apply Molykote grease to the fuselage surface. (4) Apply PR1440B2 sealant to the plate surface (Refer to SRM 51-20-01). (5) Install the protective plate (2). (6) Wet-assemble the screws (1) moist with CA-1000 sealant. (7) Apply P/S870B-2 sealant along the contour of the protective plate (Refer to SRM 51-20-01). K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Do these steps, if a new protective plate was installed. (a) Install the passenger-cabin floor panels (Refer to AMM TASK 53-01-02-400-801- A/400 or AMM TASK 53-01-02-400-802-A/400, as applicable). (b) Close the service door.
